If you like the sound of "2012," I would recommend watching "Three Kings" (2019).

"Three Kings" is a modern documentary that focuses on three triathletes from the same small town training for the triathlon World Championships.

One of the athletes, Bill Chaffey, was training for his first Olympic distance triathlon when he was involved in a horrendous accident that left him a paraplegic.

For four years he trained himself in the disciplines of wheelchair and hand cycle racing to complete his dream of completing a triathlon and representing Australia in a World event while remaining just one of the boys.

conversation.text: I would recommend "Passion" as a heartwarming and inspiring movie. The plot revolves around Jack Passion, who has defied social convention and become an ambassador for the sport of competitive beard growing. Through good times and bad, he has pushed on to become the two time world beard champion. He shares this inspirational story with us and guides us through his world in a 6 minute narrative doc. He considers what his world has become due to his beard and contemplates the thought of a world without.
